snippet.title: Roundtable: Facebook's $2 billion long-term bet on VR
snippet.description: Analysts and tech experts share their opinions on what Facebook's purchase of Oculus really means to the future of VR and crowdfunding.

snippet.title: 10 ways enterprise IT Is changing
snippet.description: From the rising influence of marketing to the impact of mobile to the realities of offshoring, 2014 is going to have its share of trends and disruptions that affect IT.

snippet.title: 10 things I miss about old technology
snippet.description: Take a trip down memory lane as Scott Matteson shares some of his favorite memories about technology from way-back-when.

snippet.title: Bad Astronomy's Phil Plait on worm holes, the Hubble telescope, spaghettification, and sci-fi
snippet.description: In this interview, astronomer, science writer, and sci-fi fan Phil Plait talks about getting hooked on astronomy, working on the Hubble telescope, palling around with Neil deGrasse...

snippet.title: Migrate 3D Pinball for Windows Space Cadet from XP to Windows 7
snippet.description: Greg Shultz shows you how to migrate 3D Pinball for Windows - Space Cadet from Windows XP to Windows 7.

snippet.title: Impressive LEGO creations on display at Brickworld Indy 2012
snippet.description: LEGO fans are sure to like these photos and video from Brickworld Indy 2012 that show off some of the builders' fun, elaborate, and jaw-dropping creations.

snippet.title: Godzilla's past, present, and hopefully not lousy future: A three-film primer
snippet.description: Ken Hardin highlights three lesser-circulated Godzilla flicks that offer a quick survey of the Big G's film career.

snippet.title: The new Windows logo: It's not as bad or as good as you think
snippet.description: Ugly or not, Deb Shinder argues that the new Windows 8 logo accomplishes its primary objective.

snippet.title: The year's most amazing geek kids
snippet.description: Read about some of the kids who pushed science and technology further in 2011, in such fields as astronomy, astrophysics, computer security, and mobile game development.

snippet.title: Are CIOs' ambitions being crushed by 'digitally illiterate' boards?
snippet.description: Steve Ranger's Notebook: But if you can't join 'em, beat 'em...
